title: Ticket #5251: Build failures on Fedora / AArch64
description:
See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1259666

read_user_log.h attempts to define its own int64_t in order to avoid including config.h. However, the logic appears to fail on 64-bit non-x86 platforms.

The patch from Fedora looks OK -- however, it's probably safer to have cmake generate the header file with the appropriate value. We don't want to maintain our own int64_t detection logic in addition to what's in cmake.
remarks:
2020-Jun-26 12:03:19 by tim:
This is no longer a problem in the current code base.
creator: bbockelm
